description:
A prison transport ship drops on top of a shopping mall, and the aliens get loose. You need to chase them in various locations like subway environment, up to MIB headquarters.

MIB II: Alien Pursuit is an 3D rail shooter where camera moves along a predefined path. Tapping screen with stylus is used to fire at the aliens. In-game consists of a view rendered as simple 3D graphics and enemies drawn as animated 2D images mixed with the 3D view. The story driving cutscenes are created with the 3D engine. The game is bundled with Sony Ericsson P800 phones.
title: Men in Black II: Alien Pursuit

description:
Stunt Run is a stunt driving game reminiscent of Stunt Car Racer. It lets you race four different cars on a challenging track, which features jumps and curves, with no edges to lean against. The physics model for driving the car is somewhat realistic with different handling for each car. The graphics are drawn using flat 3D polygons.

The game is bundled with the Sony Ericsson P800 phones. The car is controlled by using stylus on touch screen to control acceleration and braking, and the steering is handled with a scrolling wheel of the device.
title: Stunt Run

description:
In Stunt Plane you must fly a biplane through different shapes like circles. You can also do stunts like pop balloons and roll the plane to get bonus points. Some levels have turbulence which adds more to the challenge of flying through all the shapes.

The direction for the biplane is controlled with directional controller. The plane can be rolled with 45 degree steps, making it easier to align with angled shapes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Preparing to fly through a more challenging shape in angled position in Level 4.
Level 1, preparing to fly through the very first shape.
Late in level 2, after just flying through a shape and preparing to pop a balloon.

title: Stunt Plane

description:
Vector Blaster is an arcade style game for the N-Gage, PocketPC and Symbian mobile devices inspired by the arcade classic Tempest. Vector Blaster uses a 3D engine to put an updated spin on the old vector/line graphics style. Gameplay is done level-by-level; in each the goal is pretty much the same: blow up the bad things flying at you while avoiding things you can't blow up and grabbing power ups. Bosses are thrown in every few levels to spice things up.

The bosses include "the twin shooter spinning bad guy" - This dude fires explosives at you that, if gone untouched, will damage your movement ability and lock you in a corner, and "the big evil floating head of doom named Ghotran".
title: Vector Blaster

description:
Magic, clad in her red bikini, awakes to find herself on a tropical beach she has never seen before. Is she just dreaming or is she really here? And, what is this place?

There is no introduction, so it is up to you to find out what is going on. Help Magic explore her new surroundings and discover where she is and why she is there.

Press the main central button on your phone to get the main gameplay menu. Arrows buttons on your phone move Magic from place to place. To stop her walking, press the arrow button again. There are items to collect which go into an inventory. There are 10 game save slots and the option to load saved games.
title: Magic's Quest II: The Dream

description: A fan remake of Alley Cat, carefully styled to maintain several minor distinctions for legal purposes, this game nonetheless aims to generally reproduce the platforming minigame adventures of the original, in which a small cat in a back alley bounds from the lane to clotheslines and into apartments in a tenement building, there to explore such feline activities as eating goldfish from an aquarium and knocking over a canary cage. Where the cat goes, encounters up and down the food chain with dogs and mice aren't far behind!
title: Alley Cat's Life

description:
Super Fighter Block Battle picks up the story after Super Fighter, but the beat-em-up gameplay is now presented as a Tetris variant. The game pits the player against computer (or human) controlled opponents who can be defeated by either filling their screen with garbage blocks or by knocking them out. This is done by clearing more lines and faster than the opponent. Damage is based on previous hints and the amount of blocks on the screen. There are also flashing blocks that heal the player when they are used to form a line.

The game offers three game modes: a story mode, a two player mode (using two copies of the game, two phones and a bluetooth connection) and a practice mode.
title: Super Fighter Block Battle

description:
Global Race: Raging Thunder is a mobile arcade racing game. It plays similarly to Polarbit's original Raging Thunder game but consists of different tracks and different cars. The game is in full 3D and the player gets to control three different sport cars from a third-person perspective. The cars differ in speed, acceleration and handling. The game's tracks are based on real life locations including Paris, Moscow, San Francisco, Jakarta and Rio de Janeiro. The game can be played by up to four players in multiplayer over Bluetooth or against three AI opponents. It's also possible to compete in a time trial where the player just competes against the clock.

The game also features Gamelion's global racing community. This includes a track editor, tools for user generated content as well as web and mobile cross multiplayer.

The game was designed to showcase the capabilities of the Nokia E90 Communicator and was released as freeware by Nokia. Due to this it requires a S60 3rd Edition phone with a dedicated 3D graphics accelerator. Both vertical and horizontal modes are available and the game takes advantage of the phone's 800x360 pixels screen. The phone's tilt motion control is used for steering.
title: Global Race: Raging Thunder

description:
The Dwarf Aybund has discovered a way to make incorrectly mined gems valuable - now it's up to the player to take control in Sapphire Spires and produce as many as possible.

The gameplay is very similar to Columns. Gems of varying types are dropped in groups of three into a tank, the order and movement must be manipulated to make lines of three or more of the same type (vertical, horizontal or diagonal), so that they can be taken out. If the container gets full, it must be replaced and the player loses one of his limited attempts to play further. Sometimes, objects other than Gems will also appear, such as heavy objects which can be used to push down entire rows. Once enough good gems have been produced, the player advances to the next stage.
title: Sapphire Spires

description:
Ovi Maps Racing is a location-based top-down racing game. The game uses the player's real world location to map the environment into a fantasy race track. After determining the starting location, the player gets to design his own tracks by drawing an orange line over the map. At each intersection arrows appear with possible directions and selecting one of them then creates a route. The visual design does not consist of a real map, but drawn graphics as a layer using the real data. Next to the custom locations it is also possible to select major European cities such as Lisbon, London, Madrid, Monaco and more to race over a pre-designed track. Tracks can be saved for later use.

Different types of sports cars are available to race with statistics based on cornering, power and stability. Racing can optionally be done against a ghost car. While racing an orange arrow near the car shows the direction of the next turn. Races can be done as multiple laps and the best lap time is saved.
title: Ovi Maps Racing

description:
A colors based match-3 puzzle game where players create horizontal or vertical lines across the screen. Matches can incorporate gaps of non-matching pieces which tie in to the variety of scoring modes - sometimes beneficial, sometimes not. The different modes range from simple high score based play, to grid coverage and attempting to make matches of specific colors on particular places in the grid. This is enabled via the player's control over the direction of the grid refills, which is based on the direction in which the match was made.

The game includes a campaign with 100 levels and 2 difficulty settings, 5 different game modes, 10 painted backdrops, 16 leaderboards, turn based 2 player mode with user customizable goals, a 3 song soundtrack and 10 different game wide challenges to complete.

sample_screenshots.caption: There are 10 different painted backdrops spread across the 100 levels.
The game's Campaign map, where the player gradually works their way through 20 stages of increasing difficulty.
The multiplayer mode can be configured with any combination of scoring modes from the single player game, here all are turned on for a more complex battle of wits.

title: PuzzleStones

description:
Lament Island is a fully 3D action-adventure game along the lines of Tomb Raider, but with a Chinese setting.

You explore a deserted mansion on an island using a detailed set of controls which rely on the direction pad, keypad and soft keys, and sometimes your camera and microphone.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game sometimes requires you to use your camera to use its light to view photo negatives

title: Lament Island

description:
Kenny vs. Spenny: Best friends / Worst Enemies is a collection of mini-games for mobile phones based on the popular TV series Kenny vs Spenny.

The mini-games are all based on episodes of the show such as 'Who can win a rat race?', 'Who’s got the biggest balls?' & 'Who can wear an octopus on his head the longest?'.
title: Kenny vs Spenny: Best Friends, Worst Enemies

description: The Big Roll In Paradise is a bocce game which mixes this relaxed ball sport with a story that has players explore Paradise Island, challenge different players, collect mystic artefacts while trying to uncover the secrets of the island. The objective of the game is to throw a small ball, the jack, then try to hit it with bigger balls. The winner is the player whose balls are closer to the jack. With the help of the locals, players can also find hidden locations and try different mini-games.
title: The Big Roll in Paradise

description:
Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - Legend is a mobile game version of the console/PC game of the same name. The game takes place in three of the locations of the original game: Tokyo, Ghana and Cornwall. Each location has its own visual style and contains three levels. Lara's quest is to find Excalibur, King Arthur's famous sword which has been shattered into three pieces. The first shard is believed to be in the possession of a Japanese relic collector named Takamoto so Lara goes to Tokyo in an attempt to get the shard. The problem however is that Takamoto is a boss of the Yakuza who likely won't give it away freely.

The game is a side-scrolling platformer with polygonal 3D graphics. Most of the gameplay involves running left and right, jumping between platforms and shooting the various enemies that stand in Lara's way. Obstacles such as electric cables and laser defense systems have to be avoided either by jumping over or rolling under. Sometimes Lara has to swing around poles or use her grappling hook to reach far off platforms. The grappling hook can also be used to swing into and knock out enemies. The gunfights are quite simple and only Lara's regular handgun can be used. Bullets can be dodged by crouching but the enemies can do the same.

Next to the Symbian version of the game, there is also a J2ME version called Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - Legend: Tokyo that only includes the first location of the game.
title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider - Legend

alternate_titles.title: Romance of Three Kindoms: Hero Occurrence

title: Romance of Three Kingdoms: Hero Occurrence

description: Bounce Touch is a part of Nokia’s Bounce series of games. It is a 3D puzzle-platformer featuring a red ball as the main character. Players have to move Bounce towards houses while avoiding falling and bouncing on other obstacles such as enemies on his way.

sample_screenshots.caption: This evil brick hypnotized Bounce's friends.
We meet the villain right away.
Oh no, I hope I don't fall...

title: Bounce Touch

description:
The Da Vinci Code 3D is a 2006 adventure game. It is based on the novel by Dan Brown and its subsequent movie adaptation. In the game, the player takes on the role of symbologist Robert Langdon as he attempts to solve the mystery behind the murder of the curator of the Louvre museum.

Gameplay takes place in a 3D environment and requires the player to navigate the levels using character-relative controls, or "tank controls," which was a common control scheme for systems that do not support analog sticks. The game's primary objective is to explore the environments, examine various objects, and speak with characters in order to advance the plot. While there are no action sequences, the game does include various puzzles that employ different mechanics, such as entering numbers into keypads or turning lock cylinders to pick door locks.
title: The Da Vinci Code 3D
